summary: Treasury’s Fiscal Service issues debt to borrow money for federal operations and reports the debt on financial statements called the Schedules of Federal Debt. As of September 30, 2025, the federal debt was $37.6 trillion—up $2.2 trillion from FY 2024. Interest on the debt in FY 2025 increased to $1.2 trillion. We audit and issue opinions annually on the Schedules and on related internal controls...
title: Financial Audit: Bureau of the Fiscal Service’s FY 2025 and FY 2024 Schedules of Federal Debt
